availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Volney Baker (McLean County, Kentucky, farmer and Captain (U.S.A.))

body.p: McLean County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of David Baker and Mahala Baker. Resident in Muhlenberg County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in McLean County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in 35th Regiment Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Captain from October 2, 1863 to December 29, 1864.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 1, p. 390-391.Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McLean County, p. 99-100. Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 356. Headstones Provided for Deceased Union Civil War Veterans, 1861-1904, Records of the Office of the Quartermaster General, Group Number: 92, Series #M1845.
